title: Where the Bands Are
name: Where the Bands Are
description:
A Map by Plasticpaddy

Track 'em down here.

properties.name: Camden County Emerald Society Pipes and Drums
properties.description: Posted by Plasticpaddy201 W. Hobart Drive Laurel Springs, NJ 08021 The Camden County Emerald Society Pipes and Drums were formed in 1995 by members of Chapter 10 of the Emerald Society of the State of New Jersey who realized the need for a police and fire band. We are comprised of active and retired policemen, firemen, emergency medical technicians and former U.S. military members.

properties.name: Cameron Highlanders Pipe Band
properties.description: Posted by Plasticpaddy3025 Church Road, Lafayette Hill, PA 19444For more than 50 years, bringing the music of the Great Highland bagpipes to the Delaware Valley

properties.name: Cape-Atlantic Police and Fire Irish Pipe Brigade
properties.description: Posted by Plasticpaddy4 Moore Road, Cape May Courthouse, NJ 08210

properties.name: First Highland Watch of Pennsylvania
properties.description: Posted by Plasticpaddy20 Irving Place, Feasterville, PA 19053The Watch is a competition pipe band that is a Grade 4 member of the Eastern United States Pipe Band Association The purpose of the band is to provide quality instruction and a place to celebrate the Scottish arts of piping and drumming. Visitors are always welcome to practise. We encourage everyone to explore becoming a member or student of the band.

properties.name: Irish Thunder Pipes and Drums
properties.description: Posted by Plasticpaddy342 Jefferson St., Swedesburg, PA 19405A parade band representing AOH Division 1, Montgomery County.

properties.name: Philadelphia Emerald Society Pipe Band
properties.description: Posted by Plasticpaddy6815 Emlen St.,,Philadelphia,PA 19119The Philadelphia Emerald Society Pipe Band is over 35 years old and is the premier Irish pipe and drum band in the Delaware Valley. The band has performed in this area as well as surrounding states, and on several occasions in the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland. Emerald has marched in the Philadelphia St. Patrick\'s Day Parade every year since its founding. The band is also a Grade 4 competition unit. Emerald is a longtime member of the Eastern United States Pipe Band Association.

properties.name: Ulster Scottish Pipe Band
properties.description: Posted by Plasticpaddy905 S. Waterloo Road, Devon, PA 19333The Ulster Scottish Pipe Band was formed in 1922, making it one of the oldest pipe bands in the United States. It is primarily a Grade 3 competition band, and was honored several years ago and in January 2007 by opening for several Rod Stewart concerts. The band is currently under the direction of Pipe Major Dave Hall and Drum Sgt. Eric Knudsen.

properties.name: Valley Forge Highland Band
properties.description: Posted by Plasticpaddy535 Haws Ave., Norristown, PA

properties.name: Washington Memorial Pipe Band
properties.description: Posted by Plasticpaddy1001 Eagle Road, Wayne, PA 19087The Washington Memorial Pipe Band was founded in 1939 in Ardmore, Pennsylvania and is one of the oldest pipe bands in America. The band has made a home at Valley Forge Military Academy & College, through the generosity of RADM Peter A. C. Long and the VFMA&C Board of Trustees. The band meets on campus each week for rehearsals and instructional sessions. The Pipe Band maintains a busy schedule of parades and concerts across Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware and Maryland. It also actively competes at Highland games regularly held throughout the United States.
